Ryan Riley wrote:
> As to the idea of a message queue being only a non-REST architectural 
> pattern, I don't quite follow. (Of course, I'm still new to most of this 
> so I would generally just nod and accept.) What is Atom if not an 
> excellent medium for providing a message queue? Why not POST/PUT the 
> intermediary resources, display their state via Atom feeds and, once 
> everything is published, take your final action to the final state? You 
> now have a transaction-ish process using fully RESTful /and/ meaningful 
> semantics with full audit support.
> 

I think Roy means queue vs. pub/sub?  Atom is pub/sub.


-- 
Bill Burke
JBoss, a division of Red Hat
